intro: Senecio aspelina, commonly known as the aspelina groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, sunny environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Senecio aspelina is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and unique appearance.
